alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 31 at 4:23AM CST until January 01 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected with total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. Dangerous wind chills dropping as low as 15 to 25 degrees below zero are expected Saturday and Sunday mornings. * WHERE...Norton, Graham and Gove Counties. * WHEN...The Winter Storm Warning is in effect from midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Saturday. Wind Chill Advisories are also in effect on both Saturday and Sunday mornings. * IMPACTS...Travel is expected to be hazardous to potentially dangerous at times. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and livestock. If traveling for the holiday make sure to take proper precautions if an emergency occurs. Wind chills Sunday morning may be colder than 25 below zero in localized areas.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
